baseline_groups.claim_summary: Cotton districts experienced an apparent decrease in aggregate mortality rates relative to non-cotton districts during the Lancashire Cotton Famine (1861-1865), reflecting migration bias in aggregate data.
baseline_groups.notes: Four baseline specs: (1) no controls, (2) with controls, (3) with nearby district indicators, (4) continuous treatment. All use TWFE with district+period FE on total aggregate mortality rate. baseline_continuous uses cotton_eshr_post rather than binary.

global_notes: Spec search uses aggregate registrar data only. Several specs change treatment to nearby_post indicators or interactions; not core tests. Two FE variations omit unit FE producing positive coefficients. Placebo tests correctly identified as non-core.
